1.text: Combine water, citrus juices, soy sauce, and vinegar in a saucepan.

2.text: Heat the mixture over medium-high temperature.

3.text: Mix the remaining sauce ingredients into the liquid mixture.

4.text: Turn the heat to high and bring the sauce to boil.

5.text: Allow the sauce to cool off for 10 minutes before using it.

6.text: Slice the chicken breasts into 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) cubes.

7.text: Arrange the raw chicken pieces in a sealable bag.

8.text: Pour 1  c (240 mL) of cooled sauce into the bag.

9.text: Store the sealed bag in the refrigerator for 2 hours.

10.text: Combine flour, pepper, and salt in a separate sealable plastic bag.

11.text: Place the marinated chicken in the breading bag.

12.text: Close and shake the bag until all the pieces are coated.

13.text: Drizzle olive over a heated skillet.

14.text: Brown the chicken on both sides.

15.text: Wipe out the skillet and pour in the remaining orange sauce.

16.text: Mix a little cornstarch and water to finish the sauce.

17.text: Let the cooked chicken simmer in the sauce for 5 minutes.
